messages.subject: Re: Another list for unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ~~but I might benefit from being on another list as well for those who are already unschooling.~~ It IS nice to chat with folks that are already deep into the
messages.messageBody:
~~but I might benefit from being on another list as well for
those who are already unschooling.~~

It IS nice to chat with folks that are already deep into the
unschooling journey sometimes.:) Not explaining anything can be
relaxing and all...

There are lists under our "links" section as well as unschoolers
blogs. I enjoy popping onto unschooling blogs for my dose of
connection with likeminded (yet very different) families.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: Another list for unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: If you do a Yahoo Groups search for the word unschooling you ll find tons of lists (I think it was something like 734).  You may be able to find an
messages.messageBody:
If you do a Yahoo Groups search for the word "unschooling" you'll find
tons of lists (I think it was something like 734). You may be able to
find an "unschooling" Yahoo Group for your state or city.

HTH,
Julie Peters

messages.subject: Re: Another list for unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Beth, here ya go... http://www.unschooling.info/emaillists.htm http://www.unschooling.info/forum/ http://sandradodd.com/help Hope this helps! ~ Joanne ~

Mom to Jacqueline (8), Shawna (11) & Cimion (14)
Adopted into our hearts October 2003

Unschooling Voices ~ Add Your Voice
www.foreverparents.com/UnschoolingVoices.html

<mouser4@...> wrote:
>
> I have learned so much from this list and have seen the benefits
of
> unschooling even though I have only been doing it since this
fall. I
> am wondering whether it is time to join another list for
unschoolers
> who want more specific questions asked during the course of their
> unschooling journey. Any suggestions?
>
> I think I need to stay on this list as it helps pound in my brain
the
> reasons for unschooling and the general how-to's (and I need it
pounded
> in daily!), but I might benefit from being on another list as well
for
> those who are already unschooling.
>
> Thanks,
> Beth
>

messages.subject: Another list for unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: I have learned so much from this list and have seen the benefits of unschooling even though I have only been doing it since this fall.  I am wondering whether
messages.messageBody:
I have learned so much from this list and have seen the benefits of
unschooling even though I have only been doing it since this fall. I
am wondering whether it is time to join another list for unschoolers
who want more specific questions asked during the course of their
unschooling journey. Any suggestions?

I think I need to stay on this list as it helps pound in my brain the
reasons for unschooling and the general how-to's (and I need it pounded
in daily!), but I might benefit from being on another list as well for
those who are already unschooling.

Thanks,
Beth
